English sentence: Once upon a time a great and powerful king married a lovely princess.

English sentence: The step-mother was very cruel to the twins, and beat them, and half-starved them, and constantly drove them out of the house.

English sentence: If I am pleased with you, I’ll reward you; but if I am not, I’ll put you in a pan and fry you in the oven.
Swahili Translation: Ikiwa nimekufurahia, nitakupa zawadi; lakini ikiwa sivyo, nitakuweka kwenye sufuria na kukukaanga kwenye oveni.

English sentence: An old Witch met him on the road. She was very ugly to look at: her under-lip hung down to her breast.

English sentence: The queen was an extremely clever woman, who could do a great deal more than just drive in a coach.

English sentence: The Princess came out of the copper castle, and became Queen; and that pleased her very much.
Swahili Translation: Binti mfalme akatoka katika ngome ya shaba na kuwa Malkia; hilo lilimfurahisha sana.

English sentence: If you eat well, exercise and drink lots of water daily, you'll still die someday.

English sentence: If everyone tries anyway to be different and something special, it becomes something special being normal.

English sentence: The idea that life similar to our own could exist on other planets, I find fascinating.
